pr_title: [#1802] Refactor device management service to return future

timeline.bodyText:
It looks to me as if the
.setHandler(ctx.succeeding(s -> Future.succeededFuture(s)))
part can be removed.
The future returned by createDevice gets a handler here and is assigned to phase1Future.
Some lines below the phase1Future gets a handler again, overwriting the previous one. Therefore the above line looks superfluous.
Same applies to 7 other occurrences of a similar block in this class.
timeline.author: calohmn

replies.bodyText: @calohmn Done. Also I have replaced phase1Future with inline reference.
replies.author: kaniyan

timeline.bodyText:
Using when(underTest.createDevice(...)).thenReturn(Future.succeededFuture(...)); looks simpler here.
Same in 2 other places below.
timeline.author: calohmn

replies.bodyText: I though of the same and I tried to keep it as close to the original code, so its easier to review. I changed it now.
